Articles.Content: 1090: You find an empty office, cubicles everywhere. No humans in sight, but there are some rather worrying scribbles and drawings of cubes on the wall. Also, there's a half-eaten cake.

1091:

There is nothing here, no rooms, no walls, it's like someone just hit 'delete' on the entire floor, all that remains are the steps from 1090 to 1092.

You can see a bit of the sky and some hills in the distance, and the cold wind ruffles your hair.

1092:

This is an empty room, aside from an extremely large box. Inside the box, it is filled with used (probably discarded) bubble wrap. (There are steps to the next floor as well, of course.)

1093: A cluttered room, unlike the last two. Boxes and other office nonsense everywhere. Looks like a store room. It's dusty, but fortunately for you and your dust allergies, you donned the spacesuit earlier. You find some perfectly usable bubble wrap unlike that discarded stuff on the floor below. You decide to take some with you for the rest of the trip. Good stress relief, even through the spacesuit gloves.
1095: NCC-93080-C U.S.S. Avalon is somehow here here. you decide to ride it past the next 6 floors to a real spacedock, looking in the windows as you go up.

1095: You find a room with many TV's and a chair with leather belts on it, but no one is in it. The TV screens are showing red numbers.

THE NUMBERS MASON

Edited February 20, 2015 by sal_vager

1096: The room is bigger on the inside, you see several Galaxy-class starships docked in between small shuttles. As well, you see the perfect gift for whoever is waiting on floor 1097, a small cylinder shaped device, with a small blue light on the top, you picked it up from the floor and keep it in your pocket until you reach the floor above you.
1097: the Galaxy-class starships from 1096 join the one already ascending to the official spacedock at 1100. you use the device as something to replicate a burger from.
1098: Zero gravity room with walls, floor and ceiling covered in trampolines.
1099: in one floor you will arrive at the spacedock. your destination is floor 1337, where the gift shop is located.

1100: The central spacedock, you see the Galaxy-class from floor 1097 activate warp-7 and leave, Several million federation starships are parked all around you, you marvel at the many spaceships, There are several Intrepid classes, Even more Constitution refits, and about 600 NX class starships. You look to your side and see a large tower with Sovereign class starships docked all around it. Millions of Galaxy class starships are docked on top of large spires, and 8 Imperial Star Destroyers are leaving for takeoff. Nearby the star destroyers you notice a crashed TIE Fighter, you salvage some of the parts to make an ion bazooka.
1101: 236 more floors left. Avalon-C crashes into wall. Voyager and Enterprise-F pulls it out.
1102: Here we have a single docking port for the Enterprise J, because it is so big, there is only one docking port, no other ships can fit in there.
1103: Get to the choppa!
1104: Hey, look, all three types of stargate! Milky Way, Pegasus, and Destiny!
1105: nice house.
1106: More bathrooms.
1107: There's a large church organ. Someone's playing music with it.
1108: Docking station for Slipstream vehicles, you see many Dauntless Class research vessels.
1109: An alternate universe where the seahawks ran the football in SB XLIX
1109: A room full of mirrors! Which one is the real exit?
1110: Found the exit to floor 1109, and... this guy's mad at you.

Floor 1111:

You stare at the Floor Number sign for quite some time, amused, before walking up the next stairwell.

Floor 1112: You are disappointed with the least amusing floor number ever, and do not notice the Jabberwock sitting in an armchair behind you next to a fireplace, holding a bottle of wine which he swirls around temptingly. You walk up the stairs.
Floor 1113: The door doesn't budge, despite your efforts at making it do so. You continue to the next floor.
